alert.note: Alert for Greenup (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 5:26PM EST until January 03 at 9:01AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky, southeast Ohio and western West Virginia, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Boyd, Carter and Greenup. In southeast Ohio, Gallia, Jackson, Lawrence and Meigs. In western West Virginia, Cabell, Mason and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 524 PM EST, County emergency management officials have reported several roads with high water throughout the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. An additional half inch to inch of rain is expected through midnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntington, Ashland, Ironton, Point Pleasant, Grayson, Gallipolis, Coal Grove, Pomeroy, Olive Hill, Oak Hill, Rio Grande, Chesapeake, Rutland, Lake Vesuvius, Cannonsburg, Grayson Lake State Park, Carter Caves State Park, Kenova, Catlettsburg and Ceredo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
